title: Chicken And Vegetable Curry
summary: The recipe Chicken And Vegetable Curry is ready in about 45 minutes and is definitely an outstanding caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal option for lovers of Indian food. This recipe serves 6 and costs $2.86 per serving. This main course has 714 calories, 39g of protein, and 50g of fat per serving. This recipe from pamelasalzman.com has 2 fans. A mixture of vegetables, garlic, carrots, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the coconut milk you could follow this main course with the Coconut Milk Pudding as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 80%. This score is good. Try Vegetable Curry (with Chicken, if You Want), Chicken & vegetable curry, and Stove Top Chicken and Vegetable Curry for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Indian can be paired with Gruener Veltliner, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. The best wine for Indian food will depending on the dish, of course, but these picks can be served chilled and have some sweetness to complement the spiciness and complex flavors of a wide variety of traditional dishes. The Pratsch Organic Gruner Veltliner (1 Liter) with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pratsch Organic Gruner Veltliner (1 Liter)
productMatches.description: 100% Certified Organic Gruner Veltliner. This wine is herbal, fresh, and spicy with notes of white pepper, apple, and citrus on the palate.
